695395491.High school students who focus on scienc:
Claim : High school students who focus on science, technology, engineering, and math courses (STEM) will be more prepared for today’s workforce, which favors those subject areas.
Evidence : According to the US Department of Commerce, the availability of STEM jobs was expected to increase by seventeen percent between 2008 and 2018, while non-STEM jobs were set to grow by just under ten percent.
Reasoning : This data suggests that students will be more successful when applying for jobs if they devote their time to math and science, rather than the humanities.
695395491.Computer programming classes would help:
Claim : Computer programming classes would help high school students improve their ability to solve complex problems and therefore increase their academic performance in other subjects.
Evidence : For instance, Clare Sutcliffe, a founder of the after-school coding program Code Club, explains to *Forbes* magazine that, “[at] a basic level, [learning to code] improves problem-solving and thinking skills.”
Reasoning : Students can then transfer these skills into other courses, such as math and science.
695395491.Compared to personalized feedback, grade:
Claim : Compared to personalized feedback, grades can negatively impact students' ability to learn by lowering their self-esteem.
Evidence : One study conducted by the Education Testing Service found that students who received just a grade on an assignment reported feeling less capable than those students who received detailed feedback.
Reasoning : By lowering students’ self-confidence, grades can prevent students from achieving their academic potential.
695395491.Taking notes by hand is better for stude:
Claim : Taking notes by hand is better for students' overall academic performance than taking notes on a computer.
Evidence : A study published in the journal *Psychological Science* found that students who handwrote their notes during class gained a deeper understanding of new material than students who typed their notes.
Reasoning : This study suggests that students are better served by writing out their notes rather than typing them.
695395491.Elsa is only able to accept her powers o:
Claim : Elsa is only able to accept her powers once she starts thinking of herself as a loving sister.
Evidence : After saving Anna in “an act of true love,” Elsa learns that she does not always bring pain to her sister.
Reasoning : Once she discovers her ability to love, Elsa realizes that her powers do not need to be destructive.
695395491.Marlin’s protectiveness leaves Nemo unpr:
Claim : Marlin’s protectiveness leaves Nemo unprepared to face the ocean’s dangers.
Reasoning : By forcing Nemo to spend most of his childhood at home, Marlin causes his son to grow up without learning about life in the rest of the ocean.
Evidence : For instance, on his first day of school, Nemo swims towards a boat, not realizing that the humans driving it might be a threat to him.
695395491.Celebrities’ children should not have to:
Claim : Celebrities’ children should not have to endure being bothered by photographers.
Reasoning : New state laws have even been passed to support the idea that photographing or following these kids is wrong and unlawful.
Evidence : For example, California's Senate Bill 606 makes it a crime to “intentionally [harass] the child . . . of any other person because of that person’s employment.”

705352611.**Thesis:** Students learn more from wor: In short, group projects teach students valuable collaborative and social-emotional skills that individual assignments don't.
705352611.**Thesis:** Local governments should imp: In addition to encouraging both consumers and companies to make better choices, taxes on junk food can be used to help Americans understand why healthy eating is important.
705352611.**Thesis:** Marlin is right to distrust: In the end, Dory's actions are often impulsive and costly. Thus, Marlin's questions and criticisms of Dory are justified.
705352611.**Thesis:** Colleges should introduce st: By exposing students to different opinions, colleges help young people to establish their own beliefs and prepare them for the real world.
705352611.**Thesis:** The Dursleys’ unfair treatme: While many students at Hogwarts come from loving families, Harry’s difficult upbringing uniquely readies him for the challenges he faces at the school. Harry emerges from the Dursleys' home as a resilient and resourceful boy, with all the tools he needs to succeed at Hogwarts.

705356035.Though Harry, Ron, and Hermione perform: In the end, Neville reminds us that true courage does not mean the absence of fear, but the willingness to act even in the face of it.
705356035.Simba's time away from Pride Rock prepar: Simba's story reminds viewers that the challenges we face in life—though they may be painful—can ultimately make us stronger.
705356035.Children should spend more time reading: Indeed, in a world full of screens and images, it's essential that children not fall out of touch with the power of the written word.
705356035.Blocking students' access to specific we: Far better to teach young adults how to responsibly and safely navigate the internet than to simply say, "Don't go there."
705356035.Video games teach valuable career skills: Surprising as it may seem, to best prepare for 21st-century jobs, teens should increase—rather than decrease—their gaming time.
705356035.Only those who have served in the milita: In life or death matters of war, there is no substitute for the wisdom gained through experience.
705356035.Parents should encourage their children: Surprising as it may seem, adults can help the next generation lead happier, more confident lives by placing controllers in children's hands.
705356035.Temporarily losing Nemo is good for Marl: Marlin's adventure teaches viewers that even the scariest challenges can ultimately help us grow.
705356035.At a time when many Americans are strugg: Imagine what could be achieved if our nation competed to end poverty instead of playing games.
705356035.Nemo benefits more from Gill’s support t: In the end, *Finding Nemo* reminds parents that children learn best by being allowed to fail safely and try again.
705356035.Though he initially appears self-centere: In the end, Greg reminds us that no matter how well we think we know someone, we can always be surprised.
705356035.Publishing photos of famous people’s chi: In the end, is snapping a picture worth risking a child’s well-being?
705356035.Art classes should be mandatory in high: Without room for artistic exploration in schools, the next generation will be unable to find creative solutions to our biggest challenges.
705356035.Recognizing how popular Katniss’s love s: Katniss's advantage encourages readers to consider: in life, as in the Games, who really determines the winners and losers?
705356035.The media landscape is always changing,: If educators hope to prepare students for the modern world, they must teach kids to use its most cutting-edge resources.
705356035.Elementary school students should be req: After all, a major part of being grown up means being able to clean up your own messes.
705356035.Cooking and nutrition classes provide im: After all, by the time teens don their graduation caps, shouldn't they understand how to feed themselves?
705356035.Despite fast food's poor reputation, inc: Adults can make their own decisions about what they eat—why shouldn't teenagers have that same freedom?
705356035.Assigning group grades discourages stude: Ultimately, assigning group grades risks teaching students that the key to success is sitting back and letting others do the work.
705356035.High school classrooms should have two t: In the end, the benefits of co-teaching remind us that two minds are often better than one.
705356035.Although created to take advantage of da: At the end of the day, the United States must protect its population by adapting to change and discarding outdated systems.
705356035.Reading a novel is a unique opportunity: Since stories allow readers to explore new worlds, time reading a book is clearly time well spent.

705392302.Opting for local food positively impacts: Opting for local food positively impacts the environment and strengthens students' bonds with their communities. Therefore, all colleges should begin this practice.

705531461.Although he complains about his parents,: After hearing that his dad ran for student government in middle school, Greg is inspired to create posters for his campaign to be treasurer (Kinney 46).
705531461.New technologies have the potential to s: An article in *Wired* magazine reported that a recent technology-based initiative in Ann Arbor, Michigan, managed to reduce weekend travel times in the city by 21 percent.
705531461.Ursula is more powerful than King Triton: Triton’s magic fails to destroy Ursula's contract with Ariel.
705531461.Producing the US penny is a foolish and: At 1.7 cents per coin, the penny costs the US Mint more to produce than the coin is worth.
705531461.By visiting national parks, high school: Jonathan Jarvis, the former director of the National Park Service, says that these lands present “an opportunity to demonstrate to the public that climate change is happening, in their lifetime . . . on the ground in front of them.”
705531461.Teachers in US high schools have a respo: Compared to adults, teenagers are less likely to realize that stress impacts physical well-being, according to an article published by the American Psychological Association.
705531461.Rather than promoting gender equality, s: Juliet A. Williams, author and gender studies professor at UCLA, reports that “single-[gender] public school initiatives . . . [reinforce] damaging gender stereotypes.”
705531461.Teaching social and emotional skills to: One study published in the journal *Child Development* found that kindergartners who received social and emotional training in school performed 11 percent better on a standardized test than those who did not.
705531461.Sunlight is just as important for humans: According to an article in the journal *Environmental Health Perspectives*, sunlight helps the body use and produce vitamin D, which helps individuals build and maintain strong bones.
705531461.While the casts of American films are be: A 2016 report from the Center for the Study of Women in Television and Film noted that women made up less than a third of lead characters in movies, despite comprising approximately half of the US population.
705531461.Harry and Ron need Hermione's help to su: After seeing that her friends struggle with their coursework, "Hermione [starts] making study schedules for Harry and Ron" (Rowling 186).
705531461.Learning algebra helps prepare students: According to EdSource, a journalistic website focused on education issues, learning algebra prepares students to enter our increasingly technology-oriented job market.
705531461.Katniss's small size works to her advant: When the Careers first find Katniss in the Arena, they are unable to hurt her because she is nestled in the top branches of a tree which the larger tributes are too heavy to climb (Collins 181).
705531461.By offering classes that meet outside, s: New York’s Department of Environmental Conservation reports that “simply sitting looking at trees reduce[s] blood pressure as well as the stress-related hormones cortisol and adrenaline.”
705531461.Governments around the world should pass: According to an article in *National Geographic*, hunting and poaching have been the primary causes of the 70 percent decline in the elephant population over the past decade.
705531461.Fiona’s rude behaviors earn her the resp: After Fiona burps loudly in the forest, Shrek tells her, “You know, princess, you’re not exactly what I expected,” then smiles at her.
705531461.Participating in pre-kindergarten educat: One landmark study conducted by HighScope, a company devoted to improving early childhood education, concluded that students who complete pre-kindergarten education programs were more likely to graduate from high school than those who did not.
705531461.Watching violence on television makes yo: In their analysis of media's effect on children, psychologists Craig Anderson and Douglas Gentile concluded that seeing violence on screen can increase aggressive behaviors and attitudes in children.
705531461.High school students can become stronger: The National Council of Teachers of English reports that, when it comes to teaching writing, “smaller classes are essential for students to get sufficient feedback on multiple drafts.”
